 arrest of the suspect, the recovery of two stolen vehicles, as well as 
possible leads to more. On 02/26/2017 at 0759 hours the Colorado Springs 
Police Department received a call for a motor vehicle theft in progress.
  A description of the vehicle was put out to officers city wide in an 
attempt to locate it.  Soon after that, the vehicle was located by 
officers in the Gold Hill Division.  An attempt to stop the vehicle was 
made resulting in the suspect failing to stop and eluding officers at a 
high rate of speed. The suspect was later seen at several different 
locations in both the Gold Hill and Sand Creek Divisions.  A second 
pursuit occurred in the Sand Creek Division which was terminated due to 
the suspects dangerous driving behavior.  Officers then set up 
surveillance in an area where stolen vehicles are known to be left.  The
 stolen vehicle soon arrived with the suspect parking and locking the 
vehicle. The suspect began to walk away as officers moved in to arrest 
him and a foot chase began. Other officers, who had positioned 
themselves throughout the area, closed in and took the juvenile suspect 
into custody without further incident.  All officers involved did a 
great job communicating and coordinating as a team which resulted in the
 arrest of the suspect, the recovery of two stolen vehicles, as well as 
possible leads to more. On 02/26/2017 at 0759 hours the Colorado Springs

into custody without further incident.  All officers involved did a 
great job communicating and coordinating as a team which resulted in the
 arrest of the suspect, the recovery of two stolen vehicles, as well as 
possible leads to more. On 02/26/2017 at 0759 hours the Colorado Springs 
Police Department received a call for a motor vehicle theft in progress.
  A description of the vehicle was put out to officers city wide in an 
attempt to locate it.  Soon after that, the vehicle was located by 
officers in the Gold Hill Division.  An attempt to stop the vehicle was 
made resulting in the suspect failing to stop and eluding officers at a 
high rate of speed. The suspect was later seen at several different 
locations in both the Gold Hill and Sand Creek Divisions.  A second 
pursuit occurred in the Sand Creek Division which was terminated due to 
the suspects dangerous driving behavior.  Officers then set up 
surveillance in an area where stolen vehicles are known to be left.  The
 stolen vehicle soon arrived with the suspect parking and locking the 
vehicle. The suspect began to walk away as officers moved in to arrest 
him and a foot chase began. Other officers, who had positioned 
themselves throughout the area, closed in and took the juvenile suspect 
into custody without further incident.  All officers involved did a 
great job communicating and coordinating as a team which resulted in the
 arrest of the suspect, the recovery of two stolen vehicles, as well as 
possible leads to more. On 02/26/2017 at 0759 hours the Colorado Springs

him and a foot chase began. Other officers, who had positioned 
themselves throughout the area, closed in and took the juvenile suspect 
into custody without further incident.  All officers involved did a 
great job communicating and coordinating as a team which resulted in the
 arrest of the suspect, the recovery of two stolen vehicles, as well as 
possible leads to more. On 02/26/2017 at 0759 hours the Colorado Springs 
Police Department received a call for a motor vehicle theft in progress.
  A description of the vehicle was put out to officers city wide in an 
attempt to locate it.  Soon after that, the vehicle was located by 
officers in the Gold Hill Division.  An attempt to stop the vehicle was 
made resulting in the suspect failing to stop and eluding officers at a 
high rate of speed. The suspect was later seen at several different 
locations in both the Gold Hill and Sand Creek Divisions.  A second 
pursuit occurred in the Sand Creek Division which was terminated due to 
the suspects dangerous driving behavior.  Officers then set up 
surveillance in an area where stolen vehicles are known to be left.  The
 stolen vehicle soon arrived with the suspect parking and locking the 
vehicle. The suspect began to walk away as officers moved in to arrest

 stolen vehicle soon arrived with the suspect parking and locking the 
vehicle. The suspect began to walk away as officers moved in to arrest 
him and a foot chase began. Other officers, who had positioned 
themselves throughout the area, closed in and took the juvenile suspect 
into custody without further incident.  All officers involved did a 
great job communicating and coordinating as a team which resulted in the
 arrest of the suspect, the recovery of two stolen vehicles, as well as 
possible leads to more. On 02/26/2017 at 0759 hours the Colorado Springs 
Police Department received a call for a motor vehicle theft in progress.
  A description of the vehicle was put out to officers city wide in an 
attempt to locate it.  Soon after that, the vehicle was located by 
officers in the Gold Hill Division.  An attempt to stop the vehicle was 
made resulting in the suspect failing to stop and eluding officers at a 
high rate of speed. The suspect was later seen at several different 
locations in both the Gold Hill and Sand Creek Divisions.  A second 
pursuit occurred in the Sand Creek Division which was terminated due to 
the suspects dangerous driving behavior.  Officers then set up 
surveillance in an area where stolen vehicles are known to be left.  The

the suspects dangerous driving behavior.  Officers then set up 
surveillance in an area where stolen vehicles are known to be left.  The
 stolen vehicle soon arrived with the suspect parking and locking the 
vehicle. The suspect began to walk away as officers moved in to arrest 
him and a foot chase began. Other officers, who had positioned 
themselves throughout the area, closed in and took the juvenile suspect 
into custody without further incident.  All officers involved did a 
great job communicating and coordinating as a team which resulted in the
 arrest of the suspect, the recovery of two stolen vehicles, as well as 
possible leads to more. On 02/26/2017 at 0759 hours the Colorado Springs

  A description of the vehicle was put out to officers city wide in an

locations in both the Gold Hill and Sand Creek Divisions.  A second 
pursuit occurred in the Sand Creek Division which was terminated due to 
the suspects dangerous driving behavior.  Officers then set up 
surveillance in an area where stolen vehicles are known to be left.  The
 stolen vehicle soon arrived with the suspect parking and locking the 
vehicle. The suspect began to walk away as officers moved in to arrest 
him and a foot chase began. Other officers, who had positioned 
themselves throughout the area, closed in and took the juvenile suspect 
into custody without further incident.  All officers involved did a 
great job communicating and coordinating as a team which resulted in the
 arrest of the suspect, the recovery of two stolen vehicles, as well as 
possible leads to more. On 02/26/2017 at 0759 hours the Colorado Springs

robbery with a weapon at a business located in the 3400 block of North 
Academy Boulevard. A short time later another robbery occurred at 
another business in the 1400 block of North Academy Boulevard. On Sunday, 02/19/2017, at 10:49pm, the Colorado

another business in the 1400 block of North Academy Boulevard. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp 
northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient 
female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a 
short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well

female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a 
short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp

northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient 
female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a 
short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well

female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a 
short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp 
northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient

 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a

barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well

short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp 
northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient 
female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a

returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp 
northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient

 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a

returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp 
northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient 
female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a 
short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr.

Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp 
northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient 
female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a 
short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well

Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp 
northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient 
female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a 
short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well

Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well 
as the Colorado Springs Fire Department responded to a homeless camp 
northwest of Dorchester Park. Upon arrival officers located a transient 
female who had been involved in a verbal altercation with a male suspect
 identified as WAYNE MALONE (45 YOA). Mr. Malone left the area for a 
short time and returned later and threw a large rock on top of the tent 
barely missing the occupants. He left the area for a short time and 
returned again and threw flaming debris on top of the victim's tent in 
an attempt to light it on fire while the victim was inside. Mr. Malone 
and the victim were then involved in a physical disturbance where Mr. 
Malone continued to try to light the tent on fire with a lighter. Mr. 
Malone then left the area. Responding officers attempted to locate Mr. 
Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 02/08/2017, at 0100 CSPD Patrol officers as well

Malone but were unsuccessful and a felony pickup for arson and attempted
 assault charges was placed. On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a
 local business located in the 800 block of South Wahsatch Ave in 
reference to an employee threatening other employees with a hand gun.  
The suspect fled the scene prior to the officers arrival.  After 
officers left the scene the suspect returned. The business manager again
 called 911 and officers responded. Officers  Apodoca and Puga  saw the 
suspect vehicle as he attempted to flee the  scene on Nevada Ave.  The 
suspect encountered heavy  traffic and abandoned his vehicle near Nevada
 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

reference to an employee threatening other employees with a hand gun.

officers left the scene the suspect returned. The business manager again
 called 911 and officers responded. Officers  Apodoca and Puga  saw the 
suspect vehicle as he attempted to flee the  scene on Nevada Ave.  The 
suspect encountered heavy  traffic and abandoned his vehicle near Nevada
 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

 local business located in the 800 block of South Wahsatch Ave in 
reference to an employee threatening other employees with a hand gun.  
The suspect fled the scene prior to the officers arrival.  After 
officers left the scene the suspect returned. The business manager again
 called 911 and officers responded. Officers  Apodoca and Puga  saw the 
suspect vehicle as he attempted to flee the  scene on Nevada Ave.  The 
suspect encountered heavy  traffic and abandoned his vehicle near Nevada
 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

officers left the scene the suspect returned. The business manager again
 called 911 and officers responded. Officers  Apodoca and Puga  saw the 
suspect vehicle as he attempted to flee the  scene on Nevada Ave.  The 
suspect encountered heavy  traffic and abandoned his vehicle near Nevada
 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

 local business located in the 800 block of South Wahsatch Ave in 
reference to an employee threatening other employees with a hand gun.  
The suspect fled the scene prior to the officers arrival.  After 
officers left the scene the suspect returned. The business manager again
 called 911 and officers responded. Officers  Apodoca and Puga  saw the 
suspect vehicle as he attempted to flee the  scene on Nevada Ave.  The 
suspect encountered heavy  traffic and abandoned his vehicle near Nevada
 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

officers left the scene the suspect returned. The business manager again
 called 911 and officers responded. Officers  Apodoca and Puga  saw the 
suspect vehicle as he attempted to flee the  scene on Nevada Ave.  The 
suspect encountered heavy  traffic and abandoned his vehicle near Nevada
 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

 local business located in the 800 block of South Wahsatch Ave in 
reference to an employee threatening other employees with a hand gun.  
The suspect fled the scene prior to the officers arrival.  After 
officers left the scene the suspect returned. The business manager again
 called 911 and officers responded. Officers  Apodoca and Puga  saw the 
suspect vehicle as he attempted to flee the  scene on Nevada Ave.  The 
suspect encountered heavy  traffic and abandoned his vehicle near Nevada
 Ave and Rio Grande Ave.  He fled on foot in the area. After a short 
foot chase the suspect was apprehended by Officer Puga in the 800 block 
of South Tejon St.*** UPDATE TO 01-30-2017 MEDIA RELEASE ***On 01/31/2017 at 0959 hours  Officers  responded to a

Officer Mariano was patrolling his assigned area, when he located a 
stolen vehicle in a motel parking lot. While conducting his 
investigation, he learned that a wanted suspect, identified as Jessie 
Gianni was inside one of the motel rooms. Several Gold Hill officers 
along with the assistance of Canine Officers responded and quickly set 
up containment. Mr. Gianni eventually exited the motel room and was 
taken into custody.On 01/22/2017 at approximately 10:53 PM, Gold Hill

taken into custody.On 01/22/2017 at approximately 10:53 PM, Gold Hill 
Officer Mariano was patrolling his assigned area, when he located a

Gianni was inside one of the motel rooms. Several Gold Hill officers

up containment. Mr. Gianni eventually exited the motel room and was 
taken into custody.On 01/22/2017 at approximately 10:53 PM, Gold Hill

Gianni was inside one of the motel rooms. Several Gold Hill officers 
along with the assistance of Canine Officers responded and quickly set 
up containment. Mr. Gianni eventually exited the motel room and was 
taken into custody.On 01/22/2017 at approximately 10:53 PM, Gold Hill

investigation, he learned that a wanted suspect, identified as Jessie 
Gianni was inside one of the motel rooms. Several Gold Hill officers 
along with the assistance of Canine Officers responded and quickly set 
up containment. Mr. Gianni eventually exited the motel room and was 
taken into custody.On 01/22/2017 at approximately 10:53 PM, Gold Hill

Officer Mariano was patrolling his assigned area, when he located a 
stolen vehicle in a motel parking lot. While conducting his 
investigation, he learned that a wanted suspect, identified as Jessie 
Gianni was inside one of the motel rooms. Several Gold Hill officers 
along with the assistance of Canine Officers responded and quickly set 
up containment. Mr. Gianni eventually exited the motel room and was

along with the assistance of Canine Officers responded and quickly set 
up containment. Mr. Gianni eventually exited the motel room and was 
taken into custody.On 01-22-17 at approximately 0040 hours Officers 
Rutter-4922 and Colburn-5133 were patrolling the area of the 3000 block 
of Starlight Circle looking for criminal activity between calls for 
service. Officer Rutter observed a male he recognized as Isaiah Pickett 
sitting in a parked vehicle. Isaiah Pickett was wanted on a felony 
Arrest Warrant for several charges. Officers approached the vehicle to 
contact Pickett. Upon seeing officers, Pickett exited the vehicle and 
ran. Officer Rutter and Colburn followed Pickett while directing 
officers into the area for containment. Unable to out run Officers 
Rutter and Colburn, Pickett tried to escape capture by running into a 
residence. Sand Creek officers with the assistance of CSPD K9 officers 
set up containment on the residence. Pickett realized he was surrounded 
and exited the front door to the residence and surrendered peacefully. 
No injuries were sustained by citizens, officers or Mr. Pickett. On 01-22-17 at approximately 0040 hours Officers 
Rutter-4922 and Colburn-5133 were patrolling the area of the 3000 block

residence. Sand Creek officers with the assistance of CSPD K9 officers 
set up containment on the residence. Pickett realized he was surrounded 
and exited the front door to the residence and surrendered peacefully. 
No injuries were sustained by citizens, officers or Mr. Pickett. On 01-22-17 at approximately 0040 hours Officers 
Rutter-4922 and Colburn-5133 were patrolling the area of the 3000 block 
of Starlight Circle looking for criminal activity between calls for 
service. Officer Rutter observed a male he recognized as Isaiah Pickett 
sitting in a parked vehicle. Isaiah Pickett was wanted on a felony 
Arrest Warrant for several charges. Officers approached the vehicle to 
contact Pickett. Upon seeing officers, Pickett exited the vehicle and 
ran. Officer Rutter and Colburn followed Pickett while directing 
officers into the area for containment. Unable to out run Officers 
Rutter and Colburn, Pickett tried to escape capture by running into a 
residence. Sand Creek officers with the assistance of CSPD K9 officers 
set up containment on the residence. Pickett realized he was surrounded 
and exited the front door to the residence and surrendered peacefully. 
No injuries were sustained by citizens, officers or Mr. Pickett. On 01-22-17 at approximately 0040 hours Officers
